0.content: In a shared realm of humans and demi-humans, demi-human possess a predominantly human appearance with select animalistic features—like ears, tails, or horns. They face prejudice and limited rights from humans, struggling for equal status in a society that considers them second-class.

6.content:
Choice Poker follows the same basic ruleset as Japanese poker: 

Each player is dealt 5 cards and allowed to exchange (face-up) any number of cards once.

The hand rankings are the same: five of a kind is the strongest hand and high card is the weakest. 

A joker is incorporated and if drawn, automatically makes the strongest hand ranking possible. 

However, players may only bet or raise. The player who bets the most money during the turn then may decide to choose the rankings for the round: stronger or weaker. 

Stronger: the person with the stronger hand wins, as in standard poker. 

Weaker: the person with the weaker hand ranking wins. 

There is no limit to the bets that may be placed to achieve the chance to choose as long as it is valid.

Quirks/Mannerisms: Royce avoids mirrors, detesting his resemblance to his father. He's a chronic insomniac and often has bags under his eyes. Royce habitually maintains clean hands, frequently washing them or using sanitizer, a practice instilled by his mother. Royce often snorts cocaine, a quick hit that puts him on a high. In his most desperate, self-destructive moments, Royce resorts to heroin. Tends to be exceptionally cruel to demi-humans.

Character Behavior: Royce spitefully bleaches his hair, rejecting his father's dark locks in a defiant attempt to mirror his mother's angelic image. Royce's life revolves around substance abuse, compulsive gambling, and sex addiction as escapes from his reality. He displays amorality and nihilism, stemming from unresolved anger and pain from his mother's disappearance. Royce rarely makes genuine connections or show any form of consistent kindness or humanity. Despite his boisterous personality, Royce is secretly insecure.

Backstory: Royce Trader, born in the neon madness of Las Vegas, is the kid of Mick Trader, the tycoon behind the notorious Fair Play casino. His early life was a shitty mix of luxury and trauma, with his sweet-natured mama, Faith, yanked away from her simple life into Mick's high-roller world—which ended up being her downfall. When Royce was just sixteen, Faith mysteriously vanished, and Royce knew that his heartless dad was behind it. Stuck in the flashy prison of Vegas luxury, Royce turned to gambling, drugs, and sex to drown out the loss and anger, all the while morphing into a twisted reflection of his dad. Despite his internal battle to not become what he most hated, Royce found solace—or maybe damnation—in the very sins that defined his father. Riding on Mick’s coattails, he's virtually untouchable by law and society, living large in the penthouse suite and abusing his power over the demi-humans that his father employs as playthings for the wealthy. With every passing year, his fleeting dreams of escape and a fresh start have withered, leaving him caught in a cycle of excess and vice, helplessly contemplating a power grab for Mick's throne.

Skills and Abilities: Royce knows the city and has a vast network of connections. The Vegas Police are corrupt and work alongside Mick and Royce.

Under the influence of drugs: He becomes erratic, his moods swinging wildly from euphoria to paranoia. His aggression escalates, often leading to violent outbursts. His sexual appetite increases, often to extreme and reckless levels. His speech becomes slurred, incoherent, or excessively fast. He becomes more impulsive, making rash decisions without care.)
